title: ABP001 – Why Paid Apps Don’t Work
description: What is the impact of the rise of freemium on developers and app projects in general? Is the market just overly saturated? Is there not enough room to differentiate? Or have the monetization models just evolved to support trial > in-app purchase? David and Chris discuss this and the impact of ads, top app and publisher performers, and other deep thoughts in this episode of the App Business Podcast.
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: The real reasons behind changing pricing dynamics in the app store and what to do about it.
itunesSummary: What is the impact of the rise of freemium on developers and app projects in general? Is the market just overly saturated? Is there not enough room to differentiate? Or have the monetization models just evolved to support trial > in-app purchase? David and Chris discuss this and the impact of ads, top app and publisher performers, and other deep thoughts in this episode of the App Business Podcast.

title: ABP002 – How to Hire an App Developer
description: Hiring a developer to help you build you mobile app(s) is critical to the success of the project and introduces unique challenges for the technical and non-technical founder alike.  In this episode of the App Business Podcast  - David shares his #1 “filter” for eliminating applicants to his project postings, and Chris shares how he has uses a hybrid strategy of project-based, hourly payment terms with his developers with success.
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: How to hire great app developers for your mobile app project
itunesSummary: Hiring a developer to help you build you mobile app(s) is critical to the success of the project and introduces unique challenges for the technical and non-technical founder alike.  In this episode of the App Business Podcast  - David shares his #1 “filter” for eliminating applicants to his project postings, and Chris shares how he has uses a hybrid strategy of project-based, hourly payment terms with his developers with success.

title: ABP003 – How to Start Building a Mobile Apps Business
description: Weighing in on one of the most common questions we get from friends, colleagues and other entrepreneurs interested in the mobile space.  David shares his experience of getting started in mobile, and where that has taken him to today.  Chris takes a different route - yet both agree that just getting started with publishing an app is the very best way to learn.  Listen to the entire podcast to learn what David suggests as your 1st iPhone app and much more.
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: David and Chris weigh in on one of the most common questions we get from friends, colleagues and other entrepreneurs interested in the mobile space.

Chris takes a different route - yet both agree that just getting started with publishing an app is the very best way to learn.  Listen to the entire podcast to learn what David suggests as your 1st iPhone app and much more.

title: ABP004 – Maximizing Mobile App Downloads – 8 Myths Debunked
description: The conventional wisdom is often plain wrong, or puts too much emphasis on elements related to an app launch that just aren’t that important.  In an effort to break through the resistance(!), get moving and making your time count - David and Chris discuss some of the top pieces of conventional wisdom and common positions we hear from developers, agencies and publishers - and evaluate each for accuracy and if it is Myth or Magic.  Listen to the end (or skip ahead with our new chapters) - and hear how to get past keeping that special app idea sacred and how you compete with the big boys!
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: Chris debunks conventional wisdom regarding optimizing for more app downloads

title: ABP005 – Evaluating your Mobile App Ideas
description: In this free-flowing conversation, David and Chris discuss app ideas, where they come from, how to evaluate, and why taking action and executing is more powerful than even the best ideas.  Stay tuned to the end to hear an invitation from the guys to bravely share your app ideas for evaluation and constructive criticism - in the public comments section of this episode (be brave):  http://appbusinesspodcast.com/ideas

title: ABP006 – Emerging Mobile Technologies and Trends in Mobile with Patrice Archer
description:
Where is mobile headed over the next 6 months - 3 years, what mind-blowing capabilities are available now, and how do we as mobile application publishers, marketers and developers take advantage of these opportunities?

The top 3 “Mobile” emerging technologies sure to disrupter the status quo
The future of app monetization and ads
The value of master-minds and community - Mobile10x.com

title: ABP008 – Intro to Analytics
description: If the goal is to maximize value or your app portfolio, and decide when to re-invest or cut bait on an app - you need good data to make an informed decisions.  Good data for data driven decisions start with basic and advanced analytics and a string understandings of how to implement and analyze.  There is a great deal of potential to optimize your apps and make them better with analytics.  Knowing more than just the number of daily average users and actually tracking real engagement can help you move the dial to more revenues.  Measure, track, and improve user experience, and watch your app business take off.
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: implementation, goals and resources

Measure, track, and improve user experience, and watch your app business take off.

title: ABP010 – Analytics and Mobile KPIs for data-driven decision making
description:
In the 2nd of our 3 part introduction to mobile app analytics, Chris and David discuss what metrics to track for maximum insight into performance of your app - called KPI’s or Key Performance Indicators.  

In the News covering David’s new favorite old book and Apptopia’s new “code templates” offering
The various types of metrics to collect, 
How to take immediate action for collecting this data
….and what to do with this data at a high level

title: ABP011 – Listener FAQs and MAQs – Mobile App Questions
description:
Listener questions and exploding into the new year.  Chris shares his new project, and then we jump right into our listener FAQs - from when we release the podcast (great idea!) to NDAs and ASO to the state of the mobile app market.  Listen to the entire 23 mins to hear:

Chris present his new services tool - its very early - but a fun project to share progress “App Jetpack”

10+ and a bonus questions answered from newbie to grizzled veteran answered

Great books and resources

Semi-hacker tips…

Ad Networks and chasing the latest and hottest…

...and much more!

title: ABP012 – AARRR Pirate Metrics, Apps and Analytics 3 of 3
description: Manage your apps like a pirate.  Learn the basics of an analytics collection framework - and how understanding what each is telling you about your app, how to influence change and the impact of improving has on your app's profitability.
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps

title: ABP013 – Common App Store Rejections
description:
Common app store rejections and tips and hints for avoiding and resolving Apple app issues and rejections. Listen to the entire episode to hear the funniest and “favorite” app rejections and a fun site where publishers share some of the more frustrating responses including:
Don’t forget the “restore” button on any store page within your app.  Seriously - add it to your publishing SOP right now!
Trademark infringement including Siri and Steve Jobs
Spamming the app store (Attention Re-skinners!)
Incentivized ratings…. enforced inconsistently….but worth avoiding 
...and much more!
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: Common app store rejections and tips and hints for avoiding and resolving Apple app issues and rejections.
itunesSummary:
Common app store rejections and tips and hints for avoiding and resolving Apple app issues and rejections. Listen to the entire episode to hear the funniest and “favorite” app rejections and a fun site where publishers share some of the more frustrating responses including:
Don’t forget the “restore” button on any store page within your app.  Seriously - add it to your publishing SOP right now!
Trademark infringement including Siri and Steve Jobs
Spamming the app store (Attention Re-skinners!)
Incentivized ratings…. enforced inconsistently….but worth avoiding 
...and much more!

and the rise of reskinning!

title: ABP017 – An Option to Mobile App Review Sites – Tyler Kessler of App ReviewMe
description: Reviews are becoming a bigger and bigger piece of Apple’s ranking algorithm, not to mention have a huge impact on downloads.  Listen in as we are joined by Tyler Kessler of AppReview.me - an amazing service that puts your app in front of hundred’s (maybe 1,000’s) of users who are very likely to review your app.  Tyler is a student of app reviews, and how they impact rankings and results.
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: The importance of, and Solution for acquiring app reviews with Tyler of App ReviewMe.

title: ABP020 – Interview with Christopher Sutton of Easy Ear Training
description: The ABP Guys are joined by Christopher Sutton - Musician, App Developer and Reluctant Businessman.  The App Business Podcast often discusses Mobile Apps so deeply - we felt it was time to add some context to who is building mobile apps and why.  Christopher founded and manages a music theory and ear training program including lessons and other fun ways to learn - available on both the web and on mobile apps.  We discuss why he has focused his offering on mobile, how investing in mobile supports his overall business strategy and where and how it extends his brand and offering.
itunesAuthor: Discussions on the business of creating and publishing mobile apps
itunesSubtitle: Christopher founded and manages a music theory and ear training program.  We discuss why he has focused his offering on mobile, how investing in mobile supports his overall business strategy and where and how it extends his brand and offering.

title: ABP068 – Struggling Developers
description: Chris and David talked about the recent TechCrunch article about the Vision Mobile's Developer Economic's report for Q3. According to the report, 50% of iOS developers and 64% of Android developers are below the ‘app poverty line” of $500 per app per month. Are app businesses really sustainable or not?Being an app publisher and developer themselves, listen in as Chris and Davis shares their point of view on this.
